page.title: 16OUR WEEKENDS
page.content:
The weekends provide opportunities for children to relax from the routine of school,even though they wake early. Debbie Steer writes---"On Saturday I woke up at around 7:00 A.M.and read 'The Ship of Adventure'.Then I watched 'Good Morning Britain'on television."
Not everyone rises quite so early ,especially on Sundays. Tracey Hunt writes---"At Ten I had just woken.After breakfast we went to the{Playing Field}to play Cricket."
The traditional Sunday lunch (refered to as "dinner") is still very popular in {Merton }. Marie Weeks writes---"At 9:00 I was helping mum put the meat on for dinner." Rebecca Geary writes---"I played on the lawn then I had roast dinner."
